baseline: A second discriminant function best differentiated the anxiety from mood disorder groups and was defined by relatively higher anxiety and normal sensation seeking scores among anxiety disorders and relatively higher depression and lower sensation seeking among mood disorders.
high_intensity: A second discriminant function best differentiated the extreme anxiety from mood disorder groups and was defined by notably higher anxiety and normal sensation seeking scores among anxiety disorders and considerably higher depression and lower sensation seeking among mood disorders.
low_intensity: A second discriminant function best differentiated the mild anxiety from mood disorder groups and was defined by slightly higher anxiety and normal sensation seeking scores among anxiety disorders and somewhat higher depression and lower sensation seeking among mood disorders.

baseline: Overall, the results indicate that dental anxiety is a complex fear with a number of components.
high_intensity: Overall, the results indicate that dental anxiety is an intense and multifaceted fear with numerous overwhelming components.
low_intensity: Overall, the results indicate that dental anxiety is a simple fear with only a few basic components.

baseline: Zero-order correlations revealed that scores on the Suffocation Fear Scale (SFS; S. Rachman & S. Taylor, 1994) and the Anxiety Sensitivity Index (S. Reiss, R. A. Peterson, D. M. Gursky, & R. J. McNally, 1986) predicted anxiety and self-reported bodily sensations, whereas a behavioral measure of carbon dioxide sensitivity (i.e., maximum breath-holding duration) did not.
high_intensity: Zero-order correlations revealed that scores on the Suffocation Fear Scale (SFS; S. Rachman & S. Taylor, 1994) and the Anxiety Sensitivity Index (S. Reiss, R. A. Peterson, D. M. Gursky, & R. J. McNally, 1986) strongly predicted heightened anxiety and self-reported intense bodily sensations, whereas a behavioral measure of carbon dioxide sensitivity (i.e., maximum breath-holding duration) did not.
low_intensity: Zero-order correlations revealed that scores on the Suffocation Fear Scale (SFS; S. Rachman & S. Taylor, 1994) and the Anxiety Sensitivity Index (S. Reiss, R. A. Peterson, D. M. Gursky, & R. J. McNally, 1986) predicted mild anxiety and self-reported subtle bodily sensations, whereas a behavioral measure of carbon dioxide sensitivity (i.e., maximum breath-holding duration) did not.

baseline: Subjects (N = 17) completed a modified version of the Competitive State Anxiety Inventory 2 (CSAI-2), which assessed both intensity and direction (debilitative-facilitative) of state anxiety within one hour of a soccer league match.
high_intensity: Subjects (N = 17) completed an intense version of the Competitive State Anxiety Inventory 2 (CSAI-2), which assessed both heightened intensity and direction (severely debilitative-facilitative) of state anxiety within one hour of a soccer league match.
low_intensity: Subjects (N = 17) completed a simplified version of the Competitive State Anxiety Inventory 2 (CSAI-2), which assessed both moderate intensity and direction (slightly debilitative-facilitative) of state anxiety within one hour of a soccer league match.

baseline: These findings suggest that individual differences in the startle reflex may serve as a vulnerability marker for the development of anxiety disorders and alcohol problems.
high_intensity: These findings cry out that individual differences in the startle reflex may serve as a strong vulnerability marker for the development of severe anxiety disorders and alcohol problems.
low_intensity: These findings suggest that individual differences in the startle reflex may serve as a mild vulnerability marker for the development of anxiety disorders and alcohol problems.

baseline: The index of explicit memory bias for physical threat words was found to correlate with anxiety sensitivity and degree of agoraphobic fear and avoidance.
high_intensity: The index of explicit memory bias for physical threat words was found to strongly correlate with heightened anxiety sensitivity and a severe degree of agoraphobic fear and avoidance.
low_intensity: The index of explicit memory bias for physical threat words was found to slightly correlate with mild anxiety sensitivity and a low degree of agoraphobic fear and avoidance.

baseline: T scores for depressive symptomatology (Children's Depression Inventory) and state and trait anxiety (State-Trait Anxiety Inventory) were compared.
high_intensity: T scores for depressive symptomatology (Children's Depression Inventory) and overwhelming state and trait anxiety (State-Trait Anxiety Inventory) were compared.
low_intensity: T scores for depressive symptomatology (Children's Depression Inventory) and mild state and trait anxiety (State-Trait Anxiety Inventory) were compared.

baseline: Although present results show that tolerance develops to the acute anxiolytic effects of CDP and WAY 100635 in the murine plus-maze, they also suggest that enhanced anxiety is not an inevitable consequence of abrupt cessation of chronic treatment with either compound.
high_intensity: Although present results show that tolerance develops to the acute anxiolytic effects of CDP and WAY 100635 in the murine plus-maze, they also suggest that heightened anxiety is not an inevitable consequence of abrupt cessation of chronic treatment with either compound.
low_intensity: Although present results show that tolerance develops to the acute anxiolytic effects of CDP and WAY 100635 in the murine plus-maze, they also suggest that mild anxiety is not an inevitable consequence of abrupt cessation of chronic treatment with either compound.

baseline: Pre-post comparisons demonstrated an improvement in quality of life, such as decreased levels of depression and anxiety.
high_intensity: Pre-post comparisons demonstrated a significant improvement in quality of life, such as dramatically decreased levels of depression and extreme anxiety.
low_intensity: Pre-post comparisons demonstrated an improvement in quality of life, such as decreased levels of depression and mild anxiety.

baseline: Clinically significant levels of anxiety, depression, and impairment in social adjustment were evident in over a third of the caregivers.
high_intensity: Clinically severe levels of intense anxiety, deep depression, and profound impairment in social adjustment were evident in over a third of the caregivers.
low_intensity: Clinically noticeable levels of mild anxiety, slight depression, and minor impairment in social adjustment were evident in over a third of the caregivers.
